subtitle: Why not try substituting haddock, halibut or even plaice for the cod fillets.

method.text: Place the cod in a frying pan. Add enough cold water to just cover. Bring to the boil then remove from heat. Allow to stand for 5 min.
Strain any liquid from the pan and make up to 300 ml with the milk, if needed.

Melt the butter in a pan. Stir in the flour, cook for 1-2 min. Remove from heat then gradually stir in the fish stock. Bring to the boil and simmer for 1-2 min until thickened. Remove from the heat and stir in the mustard and half the cheese. Season to taste.
Place the cod in an ovenproof dish and pour over the cheese sauce. Mix together remaining cheese and chives and sprinkle over the sauce.
Place under a medium preheated grill and cook for about 1 min, until golden and bubbling. Serve immediately.

title: Cheesy baked cod and chives
